segments.text: I glance out the window and see the peaceful garden, almost mocking this kitchen chaos.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The woman seems so absorbed, and yet, she doesn’t see the water spilling.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The boy is on that stool, and I can almost feel the tension in his body - it’s electric.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Does he even realize how close he is to tipping over?
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can’t help but feel a little angry that he’s taking the risk with her so close.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The girl stands there eagerly, her hand reaching up; it’s like a scene from a farce.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I want to intervene, but I’m frozen in place, merely observing the impending chaos.
segments.speaker: PAR
